alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 8:54AM AKST until December 24 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... The first frontal band is over the north gulf coast. A break between fronts over the north and central panhandle where very light snow is happening with little accumulation. To the south, the second frontal band is progressing northward across Prince of Wales. This band will reach the Juneau area in the late afternoon, while weakening. The rain snow line has already reached Ketchikan this morning. Snow totals so far have ranged from 2 inches to up to 13 inches. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 16 inches. * WHERE...Yakutat, Skagway, Klondike Highway, and the Haines and surrounding areas. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy to moderate snow is still occurring at Yakutat this morning and may continue into the early afternoon. another 1 to 4 inches of snow is still possible through the afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
